title: 210  Taking to Krishna consciousness is not easy
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Maharaj

segments.key_quote: Don't think that immediately I will tell, I will meet my friend and I will explain all logic and arguments everything and now he will understand Krishna consciousness, not like that.
segments.summary: Devotion requires patience; one cannot expect immediate conversion to Krishna consciousness through logic and arguments.

segments.key_quote: So taking up devotional service to Krishna is not at all easy.
segments.summary: Only those free from sinful activities and delusion can take up devotion to Krishna, highlighting the difficulty of devotional service.

segments.key_quote: She is simply distributing Krishna Bhakti to one and all.
segments.summary: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu desires to give Krishna Bhakti to everyone, regardless of their material position, and wants devotees to distribute it.

segments.key_quote: Do not try to understand the good deeds of the Lord, but simply understand the service of the Lord.
segments.summary: Inducing even one person to become Krishna conscious is a success, and one should focus on serving the Lord rather than understanding His deeds.

segments.key_quote: Instead of satisfying our own senses independently, we have to satisfy the senses of the Lord.
segments.summary: True happiness comes from satisfying the senses of the Lord, which is the central point of the Bhagavad Gita.

segments.key_quote: If even one man becomes a pure devotee of the Lord, we shall consider our attempt a success.
segments.summary: The Krishna consciousness movement teaches the central point of the Bhagavad Gita, and even one person becoming a pure devotee is considered a success, highlighting the difficulty of achieving pure devotion.

segments.key_quote: Any good soul who approaches me once for spiritual enlightenment is supposed to be depending on my responsibility to get him back, back to Krishna, back to home.
segments.summary: The first step is to induce pure devotion, and a spiritual master feels responsible for guiding a disciple back to Krishna, even if the disciple misunderstands.

segments.key_quote: The master regrets for his inability to protect the disciple and sometimes he cries with tears in his eyes.
segments.summary: A spiritual master regrets when a disciple leaves due to Maya's influence, sometimes even crying, as illustrated by an anecdote about Bhaktisiddhanta Saraswati Thakur.

segments.key_quote: The greatest offence is to defy the spiritual master and to act sinfully, thinking in the strength of chanting.
segments.summary: The only guarantee against Maya's attack is chanting Hare Krishna offenselessly, but defying the spiritual master and deliberately sinning while relying on chanting are the greatest offenses.
